[[Li Garte Prison Camp]] ([[Perimeter Woodland]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = }} '''Segaro Garaffas''' are Minor Enemies in {{XC3}}. They are members of the [[Garaffa]] family, and can be found at level 40-42 at the [[Great Sword's Base]] and in the [[Perimeter Woodland]] at [[Li Garte Prison Camp]]. {{clr}} == Challenge Battle Mode == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Segaro Garaffa |image = |caption = Segaro Garaffa |type = [[Garaffa]] |movement = |area = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |level = 105 |detection = |spawntime = During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn = No |hp = |strength = |healing = |dexterity = |agility = |physdef = |ethdef = |critrate = |guardrate = }} A Segaro Garaffa is fought at level 105 alongside a [[Lodmoro Plambus]] and a [[Cuyask Garaffa]] at Stage 80 of the [[Archsage's Gauntlet]] [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge]] ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]''. {{clr}} == In {{XC3FR|sub}} == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Segaro Garaffa |image = Segaro Garaffa FR.jpg |caption = Segaro Garaffa |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Garaffa]] |level = 34 |area = [[Aurora Shelf]] ([[Zalmor's Thawtunnels]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = }} '''Segaro Garaffas''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3FR}}. They are members of the [[Garaffa]] family, and can be found at level 34 in [[Zalmor's Thawtunnels]] on the [[Aurora Shelf]]. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{Fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Minor Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Bosses]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:Aurora Shelf Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Garaffas]] [[Category:XC3FR Garaffas]] [[Category:XC3 Level 36-40 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 41-45 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 100+ Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Level 31-35 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing drops]]

{{spoiler}} {{Infobox Character |name = Sena |image = Sena portrait.png |species = [[Agnus|Agnian]] human |gender = Female |age = 9th Term |haircolor = Navy, appears to emit blue flames |eyecolor = Greyish-brown |affiliation = [[Colony Theta]] (formerly)
[[Colony Omega]] (formerly)
[[Colony Gamma]] (formerly) |voiceactorjp = [https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0766497/ Miyuki Satô] |voiceactoreng= [https://www.imdb.com/name/nm11072091/ Rebecca LaChance] |appearances = {{XC3}}
{{XC3FR|sublink}} (flashback) }} {{Quote|Taion, all of you... I won't let this creep lay a finger on anyone!|Sena}} '''Sena''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|セナ}}, ''Sena'') is a playable character in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Sena is a soldier from [[Agnus]] along with [[Mio]] and [[Taion]] and from [[Colony Gamma]]. She is an Agnian human with [[Blade (XC2)|Blade]] traits. == Personality == Sena has worked alongside Mio, whom she loves like an older sister and affectionately calls her Mimi (Japanese: {{Lang|jp|ミオちゃん}}, ''Miochan''), for a while. She enjoys muscle training and has a cheerful and energetic personality, although she's shy and lacks confidence in herself around others. == Story == === Early Terms === At some point, Sena assigned to [[Colony Theta]], where she met [[Mio]], who she became close friends with, and later became friends with [[Miyabi]] when Mio became an [[Off-seer]]. Around her fourth term, Sena, along with Mio, Miyabi, and most of Colony Theta, were transferred to [[Colony Omega]] by [[Consul]] [[Y]], where they were subjected to daily examinations to further Y's research. One day, an accident caused toxic gas to be released from the colony's [[Flame Clock]]. Injured, Sena and Mio were carried to an escape pod by Miyabi and were able to escape before an explosion happened. At some point later, Sena and Mio were transferred to [[Colony Gamma]], where they would be paired up with [[Taion]], [[Hackt]], and [[Manana]], and become good friends with [[Kyrie]]. === Becoming Ouroboros === Sena, Mio, and Taion are given a special mission to intercept a mysterious airship in [[Alfeto Valley]]. Sena and her team arrive at the airship's [[Gura Flava Lowlands|crash site]] at the same time as [[Noah]], [[Lanz]], and [[Eunie]]. As they battle, the airship's sole survivor, [[Guernica Vandham]], intervenes and stops the fighting, claiming he knows their "true enemy". However, he is shot by a [[Moebius D & J|Moebius]], who, after killing both Hackt and [[Mwamba]], attacks both teams and quickly gains the upper hand until Guernica activates the [[Ouroboros Stone]] he was smuggling, imbuing both teams with its power and making them [[Ouroboros]]. After Moebius retreats, a mortally wounded Guernica instructs the party to head for the [[City]] at [[Swordmarch]] where they can find answers. Sena and her team then attempt to return to Colony Gamma, but are attacked by their former comrades. They decided to return to the crash site, where they decided to work together with Noah and his team. == Gameplay == Despite her petite figure, she has great strength, which allows her to wield her [[Blade (XC3)|Comet Mallet]] effortlessly. Sena's initial [[Class (XC3)|class]] is [[Ogre]]. In a [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Attack]], Sena starts with 15 TP by default. Her [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Art]] is [[Bombshell Blitz]], which grants a 60-100% chance (depending on her level) for attacks in the Chain Attack to be unblockable. Sena starts at Rank 8 in her initial Ogre class, and has a common [[White Wraps]] equipped when in the player's party for the first time. === Base Stats === These are Sena's raw stats prior to modifications by class. When Sena is in control, she is able to use arts that deal heavy damage. === Base Stats === These are Sena's Ouroboros's stats. The experience level of the Ouroboros which determines its stats (contrary to any displayed level in menus) is the average of Lanz and Sena's experience levels (fractions are rounded up). {| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Block Rate |- | 1, no Soul Tree || 50 || 22 || 37 || 27 || 25% || 10% |- | 99, no Soul Tree || 1,284 || 441 || 371 || 269 || 35% || 20% |- | 99, complete Soul Tree || 1,966 || 441 || 456 || 269 || 68% || 20% |} === Arts === * [[Hammer Revolution]] ([[Battle Arts (XC3)|Talent Art]]) - AOE/Pierce/Blowdown * [[Dino Upper]] - Blowdown * [[Mortal Bullet]] - Knockback/Annul reaction * [[Earth Crusher]] - Interlink Lv. 3: [[Launch (XC3)|Launch]] all * [[Flame Nova (XC3)|Flame Nova]] - Evade / [[Blaze (XC3)|Blaze]] * [[Wing Smash (XC3)|Wing Smash]] - Interlink Lv. 3: [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] all * [[Hellbound (XC3)|Hellbound]] - AOE/Blowdown/P-Def. down Sena's Ouroboros Chain Art is [[Big Bang Implosion]], which greatly increases damage ratio and deals defense-bypassing damage. === Skills === * '''Merciless Pummeling''', 50-100% chance to deal extra damage when inflicting Knockback and Blowdown. * '''Extreme Pursuit''', Grans a small/large increase to damage dealt when attacking enemies during combos. * '''Utterly Crushing''', Negates enemy guard, with 60-100% chance to inflict [[Break (XC3)|Break]]. * '''Explosive Spirit''', Own combo reactions boost damage dealt by 30-50% (up to a maximum of 500%). === Soul Tree === Below is an image showing the layout of Sena's Ouroboros [[Soul Tree]]. {{Spoiler}} {{quote|A bold Attacker, trading wounds for augmentation of an already formidable offensive power.|Class menu description}} [[File:XC3 Seraph Weapon Icon.png|thumb|The Seraph class icon]] '''Seraph''' is an [[Agnus|Agnian]] [[Attacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Seraph is the class of [[Cammuravi]]. It employs the use of self-damaging Arts to greatly increase one's damage at lower health values. It is unlocked after completing the [[Hero Quest]] ''[[A Twist of Fate]]''. The [[Class Rank (XC3)|Class Rank]] maximum is increased to 20 by reaching rank 10 in both Seraph and [[Flash Fencer]] classes, and going to the now-unlocked lab in Colony Omega. {{clr}} ==Class Aptitude and Unlock Requirements== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%; valign:center;" !Party Member |[[File:Icon chara battle n0ah.png|60px]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |category = Unique Monster |name = Seraphic Ceratinia |image = XC3 Seraphic Ceratinia.png |caption = Seraphic Ceratinia |movement = Ground |type = Unknown |area = [[The Cavity]] |level = 120 |spawntime = After defeating the other four Superbosses and discussing "Aionios' Strongest" |respawn = Yes |detection = |exp = 31,312 |cp = 784 |sp = 50 |gold = 18,400 |hp = 14,731,200 |strength = 3,015 |healing = 1,111 |dexterity = 523 |agility = 373 |physdef = 0% |ethdef = 25% |critrate = 20% |guardrate-front = 15% |guardrate-side = 10% |guardrate-back = 10% }} '''Seraphic Ceratinia''' is one of the [[Superboss]]es in {{XC3}}. It is a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]], but not a member of any particular family, and can be found at level 120 in the [[The Cavity]] of [[Swordmarch]]. It is the strongest enemy in the game and requires beating [[Kilocorn Grandeps]], [[Perilwing Ryuho]], [[Dreadwyrm Nizoont]], [[Levialord Empireo]], and gathering an info fragment in the [[City]] talking about it for the Discussion "Aionios' Strongest" to appear at a [[Rest Spot (XC3)|Rest Spot]]. After these conditions have been met, Seraphic Ceratinia will spawn. The [[Transient Bond]] [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Art]] can be earned by the [[Soulhacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] for defeating it. Through re-challenging, Seraphic Ceratinia's level can increase to a maximum at level 200. == Battle == ===Skills=== Seraphic Ceratinia has several innate skills: *Shortens duration of debuffs on self by 75%. *Increases success rate of debuff effects by 50 percentage points. *Extends duration of debuff timers applied to enemies by 100%. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 90% |knockback = Immune |blowdown = Immune |physdebuff = 90% |etherdebuff = Immune }} {{clr}} ===Enraged=== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:70%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |Boosts damage dealt by 25%.

Down]] / [[Ether Defense Down (XC3)|Ether Defense Down]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Duration of ''buff'' effects issued by self is extended by 100%. |When reduced to 80% HP during fights up to and including Lv 160 |- |style="text-align:left;"| *Duration of ''buff'' effects issued by self is extended by 100%. *Seals the [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Attack]] gauge on Art execution. |When reduced to 80% HP during fights between Lv 170 and Lv 190 inclusive; at Lv 200, doesn't use Art until reduced to 60% HP |- |rowspan="3"| '''Rite of Illumination''' |rowspan="3"| Ether |rowspan="3"| Frontward AOE |rowspan="3"| 3 |rowspan="3"| 390% |rowspan="3"| |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 25%. *Immune to all reactions and combos during Art. *Ignores enemy defense. *Art is telegraphed 4.0s before execution. |When reduced to 40% HP during fights between Lv 135 and Lv 190 inclusive |- |rowspan="2" style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 25%. *Immune to all reactions and combos during Art. *Ignores enemy defense. |When reduced to 60% HP during fights at Lv 200 |} === Superboss Challenges === After defeating it for the first time, Seraphic Ceratinia can be re-fought at increasing levels by selecting the "Challenge" option on its [[Named Grave]]. After defeating it at a given challenge level, it will appear at the next challenge level the next time it is challenged, until reaching its maximum level. Thus, only the initial Lv 120 version and the final Lv 200 challenge version can be refought. Seraphic Ceratinia has the following stats changed from its base Lv 120 version in each challenge version. Physical and Ether Defense, Critical Rate, Guard Rates and resistances are unchanged in these challenge versions. SP is not dropped from defeating it in a challenge, since the challenge counts as a refight. Lv 125=

{{XC3 Enemy Stats |hp = 24,649,200 |atk = 4,027 |heal = 1,852 |dex = 729 |agil = 520 |exp = 61,712 |cp = 1,076 |gold = 22,720 }} == Challenge Battle Mode == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Seraphic Ceratinia |image = |caption = Seraphic Ceratinia |type = Unknown |level = 200 |area = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |spawntime = During ''[[The Four Devas]]'' |respawn = No |movement = Ground |detection = |hp = 8,216,400 |strength = 2,658 |healing = 1,853 |dexterity = 701 |agility = 430 |physdef = 0% |ethdef = 25% |critrate = 5% |guardrate-front = 15% |guardrate-side = 10% |guardrate-back = 10% }} Seraphic Ceratinia is fought at level 200 during the fourth wave of the [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge Battle]] ''[[The Four Devas]]''. {{clr}} == Trivia == * At level 200, Seraphic Ceratinia is tied with [[Strategizer Nitro]] from {{XC2}} as the highest level enemy in the {{XC|serieslink}}. * While not a member of any family, it draws upon various monsters for moves. For example, Celestial Dash is a reskin of the [[Ropl]] and [[Aligo]] family's Cursed Cuisine art. * Seraphic Ceratinia is the only Unique Monster in {{XC3}} to not use the battle theme "You Will Know Our Names - Finale", instead using "Ultimate Enemy" as its theme. Additionally, it is the only Unique Monster that gives the player a rematch option upon a party wipe, and the only Unique Monster to have an enclosed arena indicated by blue lines, both of which are usually reserved for [[Boss (XC3)|Story Bosses]]. ==Gallery== Seraphic Ceratinia wings.png|Seraphic Ceratinia with its wings expanded. {{spoiler}} {{Infobox Character |name = Shania |image = Shania Concept Art cropped.png |species = [[Lost Numbers|Citizen]] (formerly)
[[Moebius]] |age = 18 |gender = Female |haircolor = Brown |eyecolor = Green |affiliation = [[Lost Numbers]] (formerly)
[[Consul]]s |voiceactorjp = [[wikipedia:Haruka Terui|Haruka Terui]] |voiceactoreng = Louise Stewart |appearances = {{XC3}} }} {{quote|What's so natural about the life you want? A life you only get one shot at? At any point, someone could come along and tell you "OK, that's it, time to go!"... It's madness wanting a world like that! The best world for us... is a world that at least gives us another go! We fail, we try again! We might do even better next time round!|Shania}} '''Shania Reid''' (Japanese: シャナイア・リード ''Shanaia Rīdo'') is a character in {{XC3}}. == Overview == She served as a soldier for the [[Lost Numbers]] under the command of [[Monica Vandham]]. Tasked by the latter, she followed the party, completely oblivious of her presence, to monitor and report back their actions after the activation of the [[Ouroboros Stone]] by [[Guernica Vandham]] in [[Alfeto Valley]]. She is formally introduced alongside with Monica and the Lost Numbers when the party reaches [[Swordmarch]] and escorts them to the [[City]]. She is descended from [[Panacea]], and very likely [[Sharla]] and possibly [[Reyn]] by extension. == Appearance == [[File:Shania full shot.png|thumb|70px]] Shania is a young girl who is rather short despite being of adult age. She has fair skin, green eyes and light brown hair, worn in near shoulder-length twintails with her front bangs pinned back and held together with a hair clip. Her clothing consists of a cropped open vest, mini skirt and forearm guards that have a green military camouflage pattern and red strokes. Underneath, Shania has a skintight black, sleeveless, midthigh one-piece suit that also have matching red lines. In addition, she wears black, long sleeve fingerless arm gloves with red accents and dark colored combat boots with a rectangular metal piece on the toe tip. Shania's [[Blade (XC3)|Blade]] is a revolver-like pistol, a weapon that once belonged to her late sister, Titania. == Story == === Background === {{quote|I'd known Shania since she was little. I always felt bad that she was being compared to her sister, Titania...but I was always told to mind my own business. I could see how tough it was to be a kid from the Six Houses. I should have tried to do more...|[[Playne]]}} [[File:FaX9LwZUIAAb1Xd.jpg|thumb|210px|Shania reflecting on her encounter with a Moebius]] Shania was born into one of the six founding houses of The City, House Reid, known for its emphasis on honor and status. Growing up, she was close friends with [[Ghondor]], a member of House Vandham. From a young age, Shania aspired to follow in the footsteps of her father and Ghondor's grandfather, Guernica Vandham, and become a hero who would protect the City and be respected and admired by her peers. However, her true passion was painting, something that both her father and Ghondor recognized and encouraged her to pursue. With the passing of her sister Titania, who was considered the family's pride, Shania was tasked with fulfilling the family's expectations and adopted her sister's Blade as her own to carry on the Reid's legacy. With the loss of her father, Shania lost a crucial source of support that prioritized her happiness over the family's reputation. Left alone with her critical and demanding mother, who never seemed satisfied with her efforts, Shania struggled to live up to her mother's impossibly high expectations and earn her approval. Despite her persistent efforts to impress her mother and make her proud, she was never able to find success and the constant disappointment from her mother took a toll on Shania's self-esteem and left her feeling unsupported and alone. As the Reid household's sole heir, Shania focused all of her attention on making it as one of the six candidates for the Ouroboros selection test but failed several times. She tried to emulate Ghondor, even copying her weapon and boxing bandages, believing it would help her succeed. This in turn frustrated Ghondor, as she did not like seeing Shania mimicking her and not being true to herself. Ghondor tried to steer Shania back to her passions and true self, but her advice came across as harsh and unsympathetic. Shania took Ghondor's words as a personal rejection and became fixated on proving her superiority to her friend. As Shania's obsession grew, Ghondor eventually gave up trying to reach her, feeling that her message was falling on deaf ears. The two grew distant and their friendship began to deteriorate. Despite all her efforts and struggles, she only managed to make it to eighth place out of 100 candidates. Though initially pleased with her accomplishment, her mother's disdain for not being selected as one of the top six shattered her self-esteem, leading her to abandon her love for painting, destroying her artwork and supplies in her bitter frustration. === Awakening of the Ouroboros === Shania eventually became convinced that the endless war of [[Aionios]] and the promise of being reborn in a clone body after death was preferable to a future in which people like herself supposedly wouldn't be able to live in peace, and was persuaded by [[X]] to submit to her jealousy and despair; she started spying on the Lost Numbers, eventually having a [[Flame Clock]] installed and openly betraying the party and the City to the [[Consul]]s. Following the defeat of [[N]] at [[Agnus Castle]] and the revelation that the City evaded its supposed destruction, she shoots herself. === Becoming Moebius === [[File:Shania breakdown.jpg|thumb|210px|Shania's breakdown after being cornered.]] Sometime later, Shania is resurrected and reawakens in a pool of water as the [[Consul]] S. She is greeted by X, who welcomes her into their ranks and shows her an image of Ghondor in the water's reflection, encouraging her to take revenge on the "faker". She attacks the City by freezing it in time so she can arrange its citizens as her "art", drawing the attention of Ghondor and the party at the [[Great Sword's Hilt]]. [[Sena]], Ghondor, and their allies defeat her, and she realizes that her friends and father genuinely appreciated her supposedly useless talent as she dies. Subsequently, while the party mourns her at the [[Remembrance Stones]], her mother arrives and shows no remorse for her passing, condemning her for dying as a mortal enemy of the City; this prompts threats from her rivals Ghondor and Monica, the latter of whom does so nonverbally and physically, upon which she flees. {{clr}} == Personality == [[File:FaX9LwLVUAAp0ek.jpg|thumb|210px]] In her first appearance, Shania comes off as aloof and even somewhat impassive yet is helpful in assisting the main characters by guiding them to the City. She starts off as being soft-spoken and expresses very little in emotions in her introduction, with her face either having an indifferent or sullen expression. Because of the contempt she had for her own life, the concept of being in the endless cycle where one can be reborn after death and have a reset in life should their life end in failure appealed greatly to Shania. Joining in the endless cycle, where one is given another chance at life, enticed Shania to betray the Lost Numbers and join Moebius. Even going so far as betraying the entire City in a [[Annihilator|move]] that almost certainly would have destroyed her homeland and cause genocide to her people. After revealing her betrayal to the group and thwarting their plan to escape the [[Li Garte Prison Camp]], Shania's personality shows a shift into a more abrasive, callous, wrathful and maniacal one, contrasting starkly from how she previously conducted herself. Her voice becomes more aggressive and dramatic and she laughs maniacally while gloating when she believes she has the upper hand against Ghondor and the heroes. A deeper look into Shania reveals the root of her struggles are a deep-seated sense of low self-esteem, a feeling of loneliness, and a constant yearning for validation and approval from others, particularly from her mother and Ghondor. [[File:Shan paint.png|thumb|210px|Shania during her happier days]] Before her father's death, Shania, while still a timid and fragile person, was happier thanks in part to her father's support and encouragement of her artistic pursuits. However, after her father's passing, Shania was left alone with her mother, who placed a higher value on the reputation of the household name than on her daughter's happiness and well-being. This lack of emotional support and affection from her mother compounded Shania's feelings of misery and worthlessness. In addition to these personal challenges, Shania was also grappling with the immense pressure of being the sole heir to the Reid household following the death of her sister Titania. She was described as "the pitiable child of a downtrodden house," and her misery was only exacerbated as she failed to live up to her mother's overly high expectations. Despite her own personal achievements, such as placing eighth in the Ouroboros selection test, Shania's mother would destroy her enthusiasm by never being satisfied and only seeing disappointment. Her mother constantly compared her to others who were more successful, particularly Ghondor, further damaging Shania's self-esteem and confidence. This in turn led Shania into giving up her love for painting, likely seeing it as a useless activity that distracted her from becoming an Ouroboros candidate. It would also contribute to the straining of her relationship with former childhood friend and would push Shania to harbor intense jealousy and spite towards Ghondor. This jealously pushed her into an obsession of wanting to prove superiority over Ghondor. [[File:Ghondor shania painting.jpg|left|thumb|210px|Ghondor impressed with Shania's talent in painting.]] Shania's struggles are mirrored in Sena, who also struggles with loneliness and a desire for approval from others. Like Shania did with Ghondor, Sena latches onto someone more popular, talented and admired, in her case [[Mio]], in the hopes of receiving approval and succeeding. Both Mio and Ghondor try to encourage Sena and Shania to be themselves rather than imitate others, but their approaches differ significantly. Mio takes a more supportive and compassionate approach, while Ghondor adopts a harsh and brusque "tough love" approach that ultimately pushes Shania into resentment and a self-destructive obsession with surpassing her former friend. Ultimately, Shania's struggles and demise illustrates to Sena what her life could have been like if she had not had the support of a friend like Mio and serves as a poignant reminder to her of the importance of finding one's own identity. Shania is also paralleled with [[Joran]], as [[Lanz]] points out. Both were artistically talented and not meant for warfare, but were denied the chance to pursue their passion because the world they lived in would not allow such. In addition, both Shania and Joran despaired their respective lives due to the lack of choice they were given, which pushed them into joining Moebius. They were perfect candidates for [[Z]]'s vision of a world for the "meek and frail" who cannot choose, where there would be no losers as they would eventually become a "winner," given enough lifetimes until meeting a desired outcome, unaware that they would be given no such thing so long as Moebius prevented them from choosing. == Affinity Links == {{XC3 Affinity Link | npc1 = Shania | npc2 = Ghondor | affinity = green | caption = Be true to yourself | direction = left }} {{XC3 Affinity Link | npc1 = Shania | npc2 = Jansen | affinity = yellow | caption = Lost Numbers | direction = both }} {{XC3 Affinity Link | npc1 = Shania | npc2 = Jansen | affinity = yellow | caption = Sympathy | direction = left | was = yellow | wasdirection = left }} {{clr}} == Battle == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Moebius S |image = consul-s.png |caption = Moebius S |category = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |type = [[Moebius]] |level = 55 |area = [[City]] ([[Memorial Hall]]) |spawntime = During ''[[Side Story: Sena]]'' |respawn = No |movement = Ground |detection = |exp = 3,616 |cp = 400 |sp = 0 |gold = 0 |hp = 2,891,100 |strength = 1,423 |healing = 351 |dexterity = 207 |agility = 157 |physdef = 0% |ethdef = 20% |critrate = 0% |guardrate = 0% }} '''Moebius S''' is a [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]]. She is a [[Moebius]] and is fought at level 55 at [[Memorial Hall]] in the [[City]] during ''[[Side Story: Sena]]''. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 75% |topple = 0% |daze = 0% |burst = 0% |launch = 0% |smash = 0% |blowdown = 90% |knockback = 90% |physdebuff = 50% |etherdebuff = Immune }} {{clr}} == Etymology == Her name is of Native American origin, believed to be Ojibwa, meaning "I'm on my way." It is also a variant of "Shaina" of Yiddish origin, which means "beautiful." == Trivia == * Shania and [[Z]] are the only Consuls who are never seen wearing a helmet or mask of any kind. * Shania shares notable similarities to [[w:c:xenosaga:Hammer (Xenogears)|Hammer]] from [[w:c:xenosaga:Xenogears|''Xenogears'']], a character who starts off as an ally assisting the main characters but betrays them during their attempts to make an escape (in ''Xenogears'', the party wants to escape from [[w:c:xenosaga:Solaris|Solaris]], a draconian society, while in {{XC3|-}}, the party wants escape from a prison camp). Both characters suffer from jealousy and a feeling of inadequacy and both characters die regretting their choices. * Since she wears her eyepatch on her right-eye, this implies that Shania is of [[Keves]]i origin, but it is revealed in {{XC3FR|sub}} that her house's founder was from the world of the [[Bionis]]. * The soundtrack, "A Life Woven Together," plays during both of Shania's deaths. * In {{XC3|-}}, the number seven is thematic and is frequently referenced, both in obvious and subtle form. Meanwhile, the number eight resembles the Moebius Strip, or the infinite loop symbol. Shania making eighth place in the Ouroboros selection test is likely a reference to this as she eventually joins Moebius after being revived. * After completing ''Side Story: Sena'', if the player has Monica in their party and visit the Remembrance Stone, she will have a unique dialogue about Shania's death, saying: "Shania… We can't leave your name here, but… Your desires, your hopes… We'll shoulder them for you." Additionally, when playing as Sena when facing off against X in the [[Origin Interior]], if ''Side Story: Sena'' has been completed, X will taunt Sena in a cheeky manner by inquiring about Shania's wellbeing. Sena retorts by refusing to disclose any information about Shania. * In the {{XC3|-}} artbook, Shania's page is located in the middle of the section dedicated to the [[Hero]] characters. It could be implied that she was originally planned to be a Hero (possibly temporary before her betrayal) but the idea was scrapped. == Gallery == === Artwork === 060 shania.png Shania Artwork.png Shania concept saitom.png Consuls J S and C.jpg|Moebius S Concept Art === In-Game Renders === Shania Icon.png|Shania's affinity chart icon. Shania guest icon.png|Shania's guest icon. === Shania's Paintings === XBC3_Shania_Sketch_Art.png|Shania's sketch painting.
